thread.title: GOP Gov. Christie's campaign to report $4.2 million raised
thread.title_full: GOP Gov. Christie's campaign to report $4.2 million raised

title: GOP Gov. Christie's campaign to report $4.2 million raised
text:
Updated: 3:25 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 | Posted: 3:24 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 GOP Gov. Christie's campaign to report $4.2 million raised Sponsored Links The Associated Press WASHINGTON — 
Republican presidential candidate Chris Christie 's campaign has raised $4.2 million for his White House bid. 
A campaign spokeswoman says documents due Thursday will show the New Jersey governor's campaign has spent $2.8 million in the last three months. 
That leaves him with $1.4 million cash on hand — less than many of his rivals. A super PAC supporting Christie that can raise unlimited sums of money brought in $11 million in the first half of the 
The filing is the first look at the campaign's finances and spending. 
Christie has struggled to gain traction in a crowded GOP field. But he and his campaign aides say they're confident they'll have enough money to be competitive in early-voting states. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
